page.title: 20GUITING POWER.SEED MERCHANT
page.content: The seed-merchant at Naunton buys and sells grain to farmers,also seed- corn and fertiliser.They sell wheat to flour-mills for bread or animal feed. They may take it to Avonmouth for export to Africa,Germany,France,Italy and Eire. The business is over 100 years old. They employ 30 people,clerks and farm representatives.They use contract lorries to pick up the wheat,barley and oats. In the busy season,they receive 20 loads daily,400 tons. They have a laboratory where wheat is tested for moisture if it is for keeping,or for protein if for milling. Some grain goes for cattle-cake which consists of barley,wheat and soya bean. They handle 100000 tons yearly and plan six months in advance.
